page.title: 06FARMS and PARISH COUNCIL.
page.content: Many farms have been broken up,some ceased dairy farming in 1968 when{Foot {+ Mouth}01 strain devastated local stock; others have been sold because of{death duties}or other{financial } {problems.}There are now 15 small farms 5 smallholdings; with intensive turkey laying unit in Leys Lane,and chicken unit at Bicton. The many{lost orchards provided casual labour and good cider, and farms were much more labour intensive. The{open plan gardens}of the new estate made it very difficult for farmers to herd stock through the village. There is a vigorous{Parish Council } of (chair) C.E.Barker,Mrs M.Brooks, G. Bunting,D.C.Cresswell,Mrs R.Jones, J. Knowles (replacing A.W.Thompson) J.B. Lawrence, J.W.Owens,A.S.Williams and (clerk) A.D.Williams.
